E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg. E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	It is wise, children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire and the goodness of it are more in cautery on medicine that burns, because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach but to the limb which is cauterized, and does not bother the other limbs adjacent to it by a little damage.

I say that cautery is convenient at all times, so that the damage caused by accidents may be submerged in the early stage of this procedure, and more so if it is for painful or necessary pains, strong and urgent, which do not suffer delay, because they are feared by those who come with malicious intent, which is greater than minor injury entering through time.

Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cautery is unnecessary over medicine by the whim of its value and virtue of its operation and size of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that her illness may return in some hour of the day, depending on the complexity of the illness and the location of her illness, as well as its nature, and this that is prepared in her body with the addition of superfluous things to it, and which has been introduced to her in its acquisition through food and similarities to those causes; but if the illness where cauterization is applied is a subtle illness in some few parts of the superfluousness and humidity, then it may not return that pain, but rather this is done in small points.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is more common to say that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, and it's a very serious matter, not because of what I understand in this case, but because they believe that it's not cure that benefits with medicine or another cause, but rather cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is actually in opposition to what I understand; and I think that what is considered the last resort of medicine is only when administering various remedies for certain illnesses, and those medicines don't confer success, and therefore at the end of the case, one administers cauterization, and benefits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from now on, it is customary to use cauterization as the last resort of medicine, not according to my understanding of the way in which common and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	They said that cauterization from the sun is better than cauterization from fire, and it was not said so because of the equality of gold and its subtlety of substance.

They said that the location of cauterization does not matter, because it is not entirely true, since you have already proven and proved that it does not work on the upper body, but only on other parts of the body, and cauterizing those areas is better than using fire; however, when you do cauterization with fire from gold, it is not for your declaration, because it depends on the amount you want to apply according to the roar of the gold, and in preparing to receive heat; and if you place yourself on the ignition, the gold burns by the fire, and in case some strips are placed in the fire so that the artisan can touch them with his occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And from this, it is done cauterization with fire because it should be made gently and more urgently in the right direction of operation.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Aches in the head due to coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first principle.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers to the coldness and moisture an additional cause of the accident from which it results, which has two causes, one being the soda and many other types of traumatic flux, called corissa, running from the head to the parts of the feet and ears, and many sleepings, and toothaches, and foot pain, and a general malady that comes through coldness, in such a way as paralytic fever, soda, and apoplexy, resembling those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first and foremost, it commands the sick person to evacuate themselves with laxative medicine, cleaning their head, for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the sickness and the age and condition of the patient and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And it commands him to shave his head with a razor, and to cut that serpentine shape between your fingers on a charred board, and place your hands over the earth of his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Place your hand over the root of your palm near the bones under the nose between your two humps.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But since the place you mentioned is already infected, mark that place with the olive wood cautery, which is this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Place it on that spot which is infected, in such a way that you press down, slowly, so that your hand may be constricted little by little, and you turn it around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Lift your hand slightly and look at the spot, and if you see already that some bone has been uncovered a certain quantity of it, as much as the quantity of grains of sand, then elevate your hand, and if not, turn your hand with another one, until the bone is visible like I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Take some salt and dissolve it on the spot, and let it sit there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Place over it the spot where it is beginning to form, on the border and let it sit there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Cure the area by applying a four-part remedy within it until healing occurs.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that just as the plague brings up an eruption, so too do gout and fever bring on the arm, making it better and more effective.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that the tendon should be cauterized into the bone, and the cautery kept in place until it is dried without causing any crack or split in the particular part of the bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And let it dry so that it is strengthened by the bone, and let it be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They said that the cautery should penetrate to the deeper part, into what is pressed against the bone so strongly in the bone's weight until the bone hardens, and this is the form of applying plasters.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate that from that location will expire the vapors of the head.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery treatment of toothache pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When the tonsils swell with pain from pressure or a large swelling, and so the fever of the disease is intensified, it is customary to cut it on the tonsils with a pointed instrument that has been pressed on each tonsil.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And lightly treat it on the second one with a small dose, so that there will come three linen stitches, and then be done later in moderation.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Treatment of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When the bladder weakens and becomes soft due to pressure and humidity, so that the disease prevents urine retention, it is customary to cut it at the opening with a pointed instrument, placing less cauterization on the surface of the bladder, then starting the sutures from the neck of the bladder, cutting first on one side and then on the other.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cauterization according to the number of stitches in the skin; and cut it with a pointed instrument on the lowest part of the back, or two if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	The cauterization should be done according to its procedure.
Capitol .xxxix.	On the thirty-ninth chapter.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	About the cauterization of the ingrown nail.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When the ingrown nail becomes inflamed and humidified, and in order to prevent infection, it is forbidden to apply any pressure, and so its menses are corrupted, and it is delayed until the cause of this corruption, and accidents occur due to the incomplete handling of it, therefore as we said in the cauterization of the bladder; and after that cauterization should be done with three cauteries around the navel, just as we have said in the cauterization of the bladder; or two cauteries, and a cauterized point on the other side, or two cauteries, and it is cauterized.
Capitol .xl.	On the fortieth chapter.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	About the cauterization of the dislocated joint.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When the humors are moistened and accumulated at the beginning of the joint, and cause pain due to the surrounding tissue of its location, and since it is obvious that the swelling is prolonged beyond the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The location of the dislocation is touched upon where the joint is swollen.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, cauterize the boil over the spot where it began, with a sterile needle-like instrument, since you will have seen the attempt in the surrounding area as if it were reversed, and thus the boil will fall into the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And it is the same type as that which preceded the form in stomach cauterization.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	If that cauterization is not to your present hand, then you should apply three cauterizations with an olive large cauterization.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Let it be done with the cauterization according to the quantity of the eschar of the whole cord, and place care in that area so that it heals.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter forty-one.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs at the spot of the boil and is caused by cold and humidity, the boil is cured with what we have said, and do not trust in it, as this is an old remedy, then consider that you release the boil from gross humors with fetid pills or artificial pills similar to them, and cauterize that.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in that area follows two methods: either by applying medicinals that burn, or by applying fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	This is done according to two known methods, of which one cuts on the departure point of the hernia with three triangular cauterizations, and applies them to a good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cauterization is equal to the amount of swelling on that part, and if it is olive or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Some are placed on the middle location, under the head of that person, so there are four cauterizations.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	If you wish, cut the circle on which the shape is positioned in the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle, the one that is a continuous circle and burn the bone.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	This is the method of cauterization for cataract when pain is attached to the ankle and not spread into the cavity.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it has spread into the cavity, then she cuts that with two cauterizations over the cavity on the place where you bring in the malady, which is the pain; and one cauterization on the bone for four days a little before the cistral part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	If the cautery knife cuts, and the depth of the cautery is according to the amount of the incision of the cord.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	If the pain is spread throughout the area where the foot is affected, then cauterize that place with a cautery for three points or four or more if it requires.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	If the pain is spread throughout the wound in the groin area, then cauterize that place with a cautery knife.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Be careful in all cauterization that does not leave the knife on burnt nerves or great arteries, for this is because it will cause unnecessary evil or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	You have also seen another of those who cauterize on the marrow bone and then in the cauterization, and an inflated candle flame inside where the tumor achieves the flesh, and the hot needle perforates and corrupts all the flesh.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And therefore a strong acid solution is a solution to the abdomen, and also death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	If the pain is in two separate parts of the joints, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	They say the wise men of the cauterization of that type, of which this is the manner: make a similar circle of iron from which the circumference should be the size of a palm; and it should be of the same size as their orifices according to the thickness of an almond bone or one quarter.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then the circle is drawn another time; and the space between them, equal to the width of the foot's nail; and those circles are on both sides; and the length of those points should be one or two nails, and put the iron fittings decently in the margins of the circles; and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then it is ignited in the fire where it becomes red and gets sparks, and then place it on the point of that one, the sick person laid on the side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize that part three times, returning to one place.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And let it heal for three days; apply that plaster over the border, and let the wound be covered with ointment for three days; and cure that part with poultice until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Diys Albucasis says: Oh sons of the world, this type of cautery is rarely used for fear of observing it, and so few have found those which regard it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But the bodies of those who endure this cautery become distorted and afflicted with that location.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But cautery is medicine that makes you do two circles around the armature perforated in which the cork of the door of iron should be placed, its length equal to half the circumference of their body.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between them is according to the size of that thing, and there are above and below, and they contain it in the middle according to this shape:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And place your hand over the opening of the wound on the side that is sick, and cover it with your palm; take hot water and flow between two circles, and observe its quality by placing a small fire under it, little by little, for the amount of one hour, until the disease ceases to bite and becomes loose - as if bitten by fire - until it stops biting.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Raise your hand with the instrument and absorb the hot water from all the accumulated pus with cool water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Let him cleanse it for three days and rest on that border until the blackness of the suppurated discharge appears, then let him cleanse it again for another three days, and run to his food; this is considered to be childbed fever.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Treat the patient with quince until they recover.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain is extended into the groin or between the thighs, place him in a position where he contains water as it was done in the cauterization.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	This is the way of hot water, and I have already written about it in The Treatise on the Refinement of Medicine.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alum and caustic: Take one part of each, crush them, and place them in a new poultice from which the separated parts leave through a small slit, according to the quantity that enters into it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Place the bottom of the poultice in another poultice spread out, and apply to that caustic and live alum in cool water which causes it to draw blood per a finger, and then compress it well with your hand; let the pus drain from it as long as it comes from the poultice laid out.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	A propósito di tutto quel acqua, e getti sopra un' altra causa viva e un'altra acque renovellata, che là tanto si rende di moto forta acquietamento, la qual è amministrata in molte operazioni di medicina e in cauterizzazione degli altri membri, che opera fa del foco.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some of these medicines are applied extensively, as with the application of zeolite and meil (mel) to a caustic substance in order that they may be mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts the case of an old man from which the operation and cure is told, in which he was cured of acute pain in his groin and sciatica, and it magnified how much better he became, and they say that none had any need for another cure, and that she (Gualia) was healed just as quickly as recommended, with only rest in bed and eyes closed at that.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that he (the patient) was pressed against a certain green color, and if it's not the right green, then he's pressed with fresh figs; and some are thrice pounded with a little gray and placed over the groin in which the pain is, or on the chest, or in the space, and tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	It should be laid on the patient for three hours or according to the amount of pain it causes in the joint.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Place the patient in bed and when his body is relaxed, insert that into the ground, so that pain ceases and he is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	You know that one should not use cauterization on these medicines, but rather the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But Mayes de Scorza says that when you make an incision in the goat's vein, the vein tightens and it is cauterized more effectively; thus, it is done so: take wool and apply it to olive oil, and place it between the foot's toes and the hoof.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	So take dried goat skin and apply it to the area that has been heated with carbon, and then place it over the wool and press down until it is tightened.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And iterate water, and do not cease doing this until the sensation of biting has gone through to the bone and rest the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called cattle cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cautery for two pains.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Some pains occur in the two feet due to excessive causes, such as a fall or percussion, or from an excessive evacuation, and for similar reasons, by infusion of wet matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	Cautery is not for all, but only for this single sort which is made by infusion of wet matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, remove the sickness with good pills and ones similar to them, that may be fitted on the two feet where pain lies in three lines according to its location, since every time you put cautery or more, ten times as much as before, according to the tolerance of the sick person and their virtue.

Capitol .xliii.	Book XLIII.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On the Cauterization at the Beginning of Gout.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Visible signs of this disease appear in the small children; and it is characteristic of its beginning in children that they suffer from a narrowing of their feet, swelling of the legs, and increased elevation and movement.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it is more pronounced in the lower back, and in the two vertebrae of the neck that are already beginning to show signs of inflammation above the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And therefore when you have to cut it and want to stop the inflammation, then do so with a circular cautery of this shape:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	which holds the cautery over all the inflamed part of the vertebra.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cut in a circle around the vertebra with a pointed cautery having two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And these are the points applied between them.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	Then cover the place with a plaster or application as we have described.

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cautery of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	Therefore it is cured by a method of treatment other than applying cold to prevent the pain.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And so, you cauterize that area after evacuation at the junction of the foot with a pointed cautery.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And it is done by olive wood cautery, which is this its form:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pains rise into the joints or other joints, and that often hurts, then cauterize that area with three or four pointed cauteries on each joint with olive wood.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	If you need to apply cautery on those that require it, then apply the cautery and do not press too hard on your hand with the cautery before, so only surrounding the spot of the wound.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	If the pains are causing inflammation in both the bone and joint, then apply the cautery which we have discussed in the chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	If the pains are solely in the marrow, and it is called gout, then make points in the joint as if you were rolling up a spindle, with points in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	If some pains remain in the fingers, then make points on the joint of any finger and on the nail.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	If the pains are near the muscles or joints, then cauterize those points on all parts of the affected joint.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the patient from a good regimen and reception of medicines, for if it is done in a bad manner, with cautery as an antidote, it will be harmful, God helps.
Capitol .xlv.	Book XLV.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Treatment for ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a rupture occurs in the groin area and you push the intestines back into the pelvis, but as soon as you let go, they come back out again, it is customary to have the patient refrain from food for that day and use lenient measures so that the tear of his belly may heal.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Let the patient lie between your hands under his feet and command him to hold his belly until it is completely flat or the intestine or hernia appears.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return him to those tight bandages and tie again the rupture over the femoral bone, with the handle of which should be like the middle part of a circle at the lower parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And now hold the cauterium from which this is the form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	When the heat of the body has cooled down and the fumigation has been done, then it is time to apply.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent it from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And place the cautery on that spot, with your hand holding the cautery straight, until you discover the bone of the penis in the middle of the duct; and then go to another place if you have not succeeded in the first place into the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Observe carefully the swelling of the intestine at the time of your cautery, so that you do not burn that intestine otherwise the disease may come upon the patient with death or great evil.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Be aware that when you have the cautery and do not reach the bone, do not proceed with your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	The translation is:
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Appropriate care must be taken for the point on the surface of the cautery for three days, so that it is covered with scab and heals.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Appropriate care must be taken for the other wounds until they heal.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient must remain on their back for forty days until they are marked, the site, and the plague is sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it must be considered that the patient's nutrition is paused according to the length of time for their treatment, so that they do not develop a hernia again through the effort to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is necessary to take them away after forty days, they should be given something decently made, and held for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it is considered that they should rest from work and relief of food and drink, and from voice, for when using this regimen of treatment the entire body receives healing.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you must direct the treatment of ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and this should be done first, that they do not heal, for as long as the cautery is made around that wound again, according to its quantity, and so it is extracted from the chain as with the other part of him; and appropriate care must be taken for that wound which has been mentioned, and if it does not adhere.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	They first said that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery in this shape, because it is marked on the attempt:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	It is laid down a line that goes across the latitude in the remaining part of the rupture, and another line above; and you place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.

De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterying of a knot or cord.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When you come upon a member by falling or by percussion, and the pain persists for a long time and does not yield to medication with medicines, then cover that wound with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And apply the pointed cautery to the entire limb according to its size and shape, as well as its surface and location of the knot and pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if the patient heals from the first cautery, then it is so; and if not, then iterate over it with the cautery; because in those kinds of pains they are punctured points on that member itself, close to it, in order to be able to attain them with the cautery before the disease is healed.

De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cautery of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some leprosy cases are treated with cauterization due to a large and stubborn wound, only if the type of leprosy made by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore, if you want to cauterize that one, consider whether the leprosy is common and has been treated with what was said in the division, do not do it, and beware of the illness that the corruption will encompass throughout his body and all its complexity. When doing so on the head, do as follows: place a cautery at one end of the head, just above the hair, and secondly below it; and on both sides, over the temples; and one in back, over the neck or shoulder.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, after applying the cautery a little while, before it takes hold in the bone and presses upon it a small impression, the swellings are displaced, so that the expiration of great vapors is alleviated from him; and cauterize on the armpit as desired.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If the leprosy has already spread over the disease and is manifestly appearing, then cover that you cauterize those places that have been mentioned in the head; and cauterize on the extremity of the nose, and two cauteries on each majestas, and two cauteries on each vertebra of the neck, and four cauteries on the vertebrae of both, and one big cauterization near the knee, and one over the knee, and two over the ankles, and one over any ankle, and two over the dols, and one over any dolh, and two over the coddes, and two over the muscles, and two on the tendons of their feet; and cauterize those on all the joints of both arms and legs, and on every toe of their feet, and on the foci of their bones.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	Watch well that which is over the nerves that are on the toe, so as not to burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes there is a cauterization with one cautery over the bone of the little toe and another over the mouth of the stomach, and another over the intestines.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	When the more points are made on the cautery, the more healing and comfort are gained; and you know that the disease does not have pain in the cautery, like it has elsewhere, so that the body of him is already stung.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cautery points can be great or small according to the members and joints, as it has been preceded by the specialities of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And wrap the cautery with flour, oats, and honey, and another cure in between to heal.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cautery of stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu. De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cautery of the wart.

De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of ulcers.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	An ulcer is a wandering corruption in the limb, which corrupts that area as if it were a consuming fire eating dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore if the ulcer occurs in a place where cauterization is applied with fire, then you know to apply small cauterious needles and larger ones according to what is convenient in that location where it is an ulcer.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And apply cauterization to it from the entire part until all the corruption is eradicated and no further cause remains.

Small nails inserted into the diseased parts that call for a nail, and this is a great cause of pain in the foot; and cautery is performed in these two ways: cautery with pus and cautery with hot water.

If the blood is expelled from the artery's wound when you rub your said and extract the cautery, then take another cautery contemporaneously with those that have been prepared in the fire, and therefore do not cease doing this until the blood is constricted.

The translation of the first sentence is:
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	What person who administers a moderate restriction of the patient's limbs and bands or ties on their position for the movement of causes to burn and for similarity, only provides comfort.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If it is to be done without the doctor present and no medicine, then work slowly on the said instruction over the opening of that vein as we have said, and consider the great constriction inside where the wound will be left from the superior part of the plague, and about the arrow he said should not be removed; and since about the arrow it is not suitable to apply water friction with a large friction in between, until the wound is closed and hardened; and perhaps there is something that needs cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and perforations and wounds with a tube, and of fluybotomy and of plagues and of their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words from the writings of Albuquérques.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes. E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	The text means: And I will proceed in this chapter with that method, so that what he is seeking may be found there, and later on when he asks about it.

E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz. E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And therefore those also are accompanied by terror and trembling, and in the most of their cases death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you not to fall into this in which it is situated, because sometimes the case may lead you to become maniacal as men are, with various kinds of madness and many other illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them it is often that you will go to your own disease and find light in it because of death, and so by the vehemence of this thing which finds its illness, and by the length of the illness of him, and with the illness there is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from those who give you their son's pain and word, you expect to have that healing, and his illness is very destructive.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not trust someone who shows you this kind of behavior; and your caution must be greater than your desire, and your greed; and do not presume any cause about it except for sure knowledge that verifies it for you, which will bring a good succession.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use this treatment for all your diseases with prognosis and indication of it to whom healing is converted, because in that one are you an assistant for the gain of fame and memory, of honor and glory.

And I have ordered this distinct chapter according to the chapters following the capital of cauterization, of treatment for the head into the feet, so that it may be alleviated what you are asking for from it and from which you had a necessity.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	The healing of water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness occurs frequently in children, causing the child to be weak and when the newborn touches the head of the child, it causes a convulsion.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes occurs for an unknown cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But you do not see this illness in others, only in children; and for all those whom you have seen dying, and for that reason it is laid upon me as an example.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And you have seen a child whose head was completely filled with water, and the child's head remained magnificently still even though it couldn't be stirred because of its great size, and besides, the moisture caused it to become more dead.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture was either added between the tendons and the bone, or placed over the joints of the body.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Where the operation in that case is to make an opening in the middle of the head at a fissure in the latitude, and so that the length of the fissure is two fingers' breadth until the moisture runs, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	If the humidity is greatly increased and the swelling is greater, then you will have two cuts in this way:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	If the humidity is left on the bones, it's a sign that you will cut across the corners of the head where all the parts are open and when you compress her with your hand on those parts, she will urinate when you press that area.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	You will cut across the middle of the head in three cuts, according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then you will remove the extraneous part from all the humidity; and then tie the cuts with cloths and plums, and apply it on top with vinegar until the fifth day, and then loosen the bandage and cure the wound with cauterization and salve, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the sick person with dry food of little humidity within that the member is comfortable and healthy.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And this is another method of incision, which I consider good when the size of the swelling and the collection of fluid appear, because some cases are more in the occipital region, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; therefore follow the opening where the swelling appears and the repletion of fluid, and do it as seems to you most suitable.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you must not cut the artery, but instead seek out the flow of life and death in the patient's disease through this flow of life, and evacuate excess humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of arteries which are located near the auricles, called "hilasesse".
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.

If the length of the incision is twice the thickness, because when any vein is cut, there is exsudation and blood flow, which jumps forward for repeated pulsations.

And thus it is known that the amount of exsudate is equal to one vial, and a light or heavy flow (of blood) more or less, and all this is according to the quantity that appears from the virtue of the illness and the repletion of the artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore, considering the plague, if there remains over the bone any cause of a ciphac ( possibly referring to a lingering infection or issue), then divide this as well in order not to inadvertently discover an apostaem ( likely meaning "apostema" or "pouch", but in this context, it seems more like a complication that should be avoided).
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Apply strength to the wound with plump poultices and liniment of wool, and apply cure to that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	 Chapter three.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the tonsils which are in the temples.

But if the artery is thin, then you wrap that around the extremity of the vein; and place a incision on one part of it according to the quantity by which the extremities of him are stretched out and contracted, lest there be no flow of blood, for if they are not incised, the blood will not rise from all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And now evacuate the blood of one vein into three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	But if the arrow is large, then you cover that by tying it in two places with strong linen or with cords long, and do not cut to the putrid flesh before the consolidation of the disease, lest there be no flow of blood.

E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you want, cauterize that area with a heated instrument inside the bone; and this will replace the messy work.

It is better work if the patient does not have fever or chills; for those are causes that can help with drying out the humors, and therefore it is better to do it early.

Cover the extraction of the arteries that you find in the affected area, and place powders on them decently made, and apply ointment with drying medicines to the flesh so that it heals.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If while you work another unexpected flow of blood from the artery occurs, then you restrict that vein, or cauterize it, or fill in the wound, and strengthen your hand until the vein is restricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	If none of these is the cause that brings it to your attention, then pause and speak about this place while the wound cools down, and fill in the place with hot water until the area becomes more solid, and strengthen as you can.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	This is how the cautery is made:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	The sharpness of the two knives should be equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if one is sharper than the other, it is better, because when they are sharp enough like two knives, every cut will be clean and won't cut the meat too quickly.

E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	Is the space between two knives equal to the thickness of the cut.

De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of leprosy by cautery and applications from parts descended from the divided digits of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the vein of leprosy is cut and continues, and sometimes the warts of the sick are peeled off small pieces, and they observe their weakness, and their ulcerated eyes, and of their death the eyelids, and in the forehead there is sharp pain and severe extortion, therefore it is known that such accidents occur when the material and cautery do not enter but through thin veins from parts descended.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is that you command the sick person to rub his face, and then inscribe in him a small fissure at the middle of the forehead, a little wide (and begins from the temple on the left into the right temple; and inscribe into the bone; and extend your hand from the lacrimal groove of the temples which are swollen due to mastication), until the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry the entire wound with sponge or dry cloth, and then fill it in between the two lips of the fissure with old wool or rags.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	Apply powder in between the wound to prevent infection from spreading.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When you see that the infection has decreased and it starts to spread into the bone marrow, then cover that area with a treatment of moist heat which makes the flesh swell, as if you took 2 parts of wheat flour and 4 parts of cochineal powder, mix them together, and make an ointment from them, and apply it to these wounds on the skin, like the natural nativity.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of a disease occurring on the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the diseases that occur on the ears are one of four species: (1) one is due to mineral causes or something similar to minerals, like iron and vinegar; (2) another is from plants, such as chamomile or fennel; (3) another is a fluid cause, like water, bile, and their similar effects; or (4) some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	When pain is felt in the armpit or another cause similar to those that do not fit or believe in the armpit, and pause the armpit in the sun, and if it happens sometimes the pain, then it distills in that one cause of oil violated or sizeless, and place aminister the extraction from it, and do the stornudar with condition, and inspect the nars to see the event of stornutacio.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	Place the armpit in some padded weights or woolen cloth and extend it to its parts, many times forgotten with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not forgotten, then administer the extraction from it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtle of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is forgotten with the gesti, then so be it; otherwise, administer the extraction from it with one subtle needle of double puncture.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	Therefore, if it is not forgotten for this, then administer a cannula made of ram and insert the extremity of the cannula into the groove of the armpit and close it around the cannula with wax and soft oil to prevent it from bursting but rather the cannula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	The translation of the text line by line into English is:
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	If the joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.

And the way to cut that is to first treat the fever of the septic vein and extricate it according to the method of its virtue, then you put your fingers between your palms and convert the armpit to the parts before, and make a small fissure in the rate of the armpit, before the grease of him in that place.

And it is the lunar-shaped fissure between where it proceeds to the pyr (should be "pyora", likely meaning "throat") and when the throat is constricted, cut that with instruments of suitable quality; then place a cloth over the fissure in that hour, and cure that until there is health.

Do not do this when you think that it already is moistened by the vapor of the swelling, and put a cloth on it, and carefully remove it from those places, or with a subtle gesture, or as we say, because it has been removed, relief comes from its extraction.

But if an worm is born in the ear when you cure it with the remedy that we have said in the division and in the treatise on evacuations, do not confirm your cure, because then you should observe the ear under the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if some cause of the words appears here, then immediately extract that gesture or subtle movement, but if no cause appears, then take a straight tube and a long one from which this is the form.

Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure for swelling of the armpits.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	There are certain cases in which the child's belly swells because of its mother's imperforated uterus, and this happens also in some women, swelling in the meat of the armpit due to plague or due to nothing at all being in that area; and this swelling sometimes is caused by the swelling of the preone of the armpit-trough which they do not notice at first, and sometimes it occurs outside.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	A person who experiences a problem in their arm that they do not understand is likely to have a more difficult recovery.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	In a case where the person is able to understand their symptoms, it is recommended that you pause the movement of the afflicted limb in the sun and observe carefully.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if there is sometimes oppression that appears above the skin, then use this subtle tool which is its form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of the person where the latitude is small, one part being acute and the other not; and the spatula has two edges sharp so that it does not hurt the skin.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the opacity is due to born-in skin on the forehead or in the flesh of the person, then use that same subtle knife and penetrate with great force until all the skin is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the opacity is in the arm of the forehead, then take a subtle knife sharp and burn that same thing a little, and place it in the flesh of the forehead.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have sensed the oppression which the affliction has caused with great ease, through gravity of being forced, force the oppression of that limb with great ease, and be careful not to plague the nerves of the arm.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.

De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Concerning the cure of atezil, which is done on the eyelids.

Capitol .ix.	Capital Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for swelling that occurs at the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Small knots or nodules found in the eyelids of the eyes which are assembled into great size in their strength and hardness, and for that reason it is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And this is an accumulation of great humidity in the eyelid, above and below.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore the operation in their case is that they consider if the swelling is coming from inside, where it appears in the eyelid and is malignant to its entire extent; and the cause of this is light.

Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if to you it is not suitable for the opening of that fistula, rather than put that you penetrate the eyelid with an incision little by little, because at this moment there is no notice in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure it inside so that it may be healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	If it is little, you will not be overcome by that evil for that, as his blood restores what was lost and covers.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.
