E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Apply the starting point, wash the heel with salt water, and treat the area with that which covers until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	The end.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	From the treatment of swelling under the eyelid, above the heel.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Swelling is created in the tunics of the eyelid above, and more so in children, it worsens the heels of those and causes their main catarrh; and they cannot tolerate the brightness of the sun for that, as tears come to those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you will put those jars on their faces at all times, and on their faces they sleep; and over their left eyelids their wet eyebrows, which have already covered the inflammation, and is the approach to a visible appearance in the heel; and when you press that place with your fingers, you will feel swelling within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	There is no medical operation performed on the person who has paused their head in your hand, and you should cover them with a cloth of linen and wool to keep them cold, and make a circle around it according to the amount that contains arthrotic powder of all parts, and place that one over that, press tightly on both sides of the body so that the arthritic inflammation is aggregated in the middle of the circle, and do not enter into the middle of that humid atmosphere with a spatula incident on the fissure by latitude, so that the fissure is not greater than the fissure made in flabotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But before you pass through the arthritic process into the flesh, cut all the ligaments completely as you proceed, because in most cases the arthritic process is made through a fissure according to the shape of the white-grayish tissue.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	So strip off the linen drapes which you have wrapped around your hands over the parts before and front, and turn them between your left and right hands until they are dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful that you do not adjust the fissure, so that with the spatula you do not pass into the heel and into the painful area.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	Mays si no appar to your alternative in the beginning of the fissure, but rather you adjust at the fissure a small amount of ease inserted while processing the alternative; and take out that aspect which have been said; and wrap the drapes of linen in water and vinegar and place them on the location and stretch those with powder.

And it's all made from Indian iron and lime; and it's sharpened with needles like a file in which are made points as sharp as a lather, by which the tooth is shaved little by little over three days' time, so that no other tooth gets smooth and rotten.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And now put that needle in the skin, and then pierce it with sharp needles.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	If the tooth has a broken part and you pierce the tongue, then cover that area with your fingers so that the pain of that fragment is covered up and filled in, so that the tongue does not hurt nor can the word corrupt.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of bad teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When teeth are subjected to concussion and removal by percussion or impact, and the wound does not heal over that area which is damaged, and you have treated it with topical medicines, but they have not been effective, then for so long as those areas remain weak, use a wire of gold rather than silver, because silver turns green and must be poured again after several days, whereas gold does not change.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the wire must be in such subtlety and coarse degree as to fit according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the shape of the hook is that you take the wire and put it twice its length between two healthy teeth, and wrap it so that it creeps over the twisted part of the wire between two bad teeth, or if there's one or a few, until the fabric reaches the other healthy tooth.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And proceed to make the fabric enter into the part from which you start, and hold your hand firmly with ease and skill, so that it is not torn.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And hold your thread tightly to which you must tie the strings of the teeth that should not break.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And cut off the superfluous ends of the thread with forceps or scissors, and place them in any location as you wish, and convert those into something that covers between the healthy tooth and the diseased one, so that it does not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And cut that straight line with a Roman rule.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	If it is torn or torn, hold that one or those with another thread in such a manner for the entire time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two diseased ones, as you have seen these linked:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when you return a tooth or two to the case of each in its place, and they are growing again as if they had been recorded, and that they renew.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	It is done by skilled artisans and wise men.

Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.

En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the speech on the observation of apotheses and in section of them.

Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	There are some swellings that do not need to be pierced, but rather allowed to mature and heal on their own in those areas.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other swellings that can be cut when they are crossed, but not allowed to mature on their own, are like those which affect the joints, because a swelling that occurs near a joint will spread into that area until you pierce it in its natural course, and because of that, it causes contraction of that limb; or if it's near the main member, and if you delay piercing it until it has matured, it can harm the main member; or if it's near the anus, then pierce it immediately, not a raw, unripe one, but that which is near the anus, so that you won't be able to get rid of it and it will become elongated into the openings of the anus, making a fistula, or being made in the terminus of it that is not healthy.

E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	You know that it is ripe when there is the cessation of pain and fever, and the decrease in redness and pulse, and the sharpening of the head of the gangrenous tissue, and other signs.

Small scars are found on the testicles in some men, where the softening is noticeable because the muscles between them are softened, and this is a sign of it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore, it is necessary for one who knows how to cure him, to make the patient lie on his back, and to encase the entire cord which is softened over the natural cord; and he should adjust two flaps at the junction.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, to cut at the beginning of the softened cord with three or four incisions and a firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And insert stitches between the sutures, and cure by surgery of the other wounds until the patient is healed and the incisions are closed.

De castracio.	Removal of the testicles.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	You should know that castration is forbidden by law, but it's not the same as remembering this in this book; and you shouldn't recall it unless for two reasons: one is so that the doctor knows when to apply treatment because he needs to know how to cure him; and the other reason is that we often need to castrate other animals too, especially young ones, like horses, cows, pigs, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	Therefore, castration is done in two ways: either by tearing, or by cutting open the section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But when it is done by tearing, the operation is that we cut the animal in water while its genitalia are softened and relaxed, so they hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those inside your own hands so that they are wrapped up and do not appear exposed to touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But when it is done by cutting and sectioning, however, you should hold the animal and press the cord of the testicles between your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	To set the suspension, and insert it into any joint where two houses process in one section.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	Settle those pus that will cause any excoriating.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	Do not look at those of the phlegm any cause, but the subtle phlegm that lies on the surfaces.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	This method of castration is better that which is done by traction, because traction is lighter and brings no cause to the testicles, so the beast desires its own lust.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	Cure the plague while it is still healthy.

De la cura de hermafrodozia.	On the cure for Hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels. Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	The small swelling is a reddish or pus-filled prominence on the surface of the body that moves towards the front, and when it touches, it resembles a bite by an ant, and it's made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	The cure for it is that you take a needle made from iron or steel, and make it strong, and place it on the ant bite inside where it contains the circle of the puncture; then rotate your hand with the needle inside while you inscribe its path around the ant, and pause it in front of the flesh, eradicating the ant from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do it with a needle made of lead or iron in this manner:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	So that the passage under the needle is made with subtlety, silent (that is, not perforated), wrapped so that upon it the application of pressure will be avoided and the rotation of it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	If you want to cauterize an insect, according to what is said in the cauterization of athee [ possibly Aethiochic? ] in the chapter of cauterizing,
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of the instruments that are administered to give punctures.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes it is done with incisions of silver or lead, or by making an indentation with hot metal; and sometimes with small or large instruments according to which ones are administered, because that one which is administered in the treatment of small children is small; and those from which the feet or joints are swollen or inflamed have small punctures.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The large form of puncture is rare.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the syringe above, in which the pouch is tied, is wide according to this method; and there is distinction at that place where the pouch is tied as many times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it, which is inserted into the rectum, is mute (for it is not-uncouth) and makes a sensation to subtlety; and in one side there are two tracks, and on the other side one track, and the thickness of the track according to the size of the fissures and more thick one small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	The container in which medicines for horse's urine or sheep's wool are placed, and the reason is one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	It is perforated by sharp points as it was turned over; and if the space between the points becomes large, the size of that.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And when they enter those points with a strong point of raw flesh which is of twelve points, or on the other side; and adjust it to that area; and when it is placed in that area, be straight on the crest between two distinct ones with a strong constriction, and put a ligature on that point: But the quality of tying that point is that you press the bag of medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the patient's tolerance; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And place the patient on their back, and elevate their legs above them, and put one cloth over them so that they are covered with men or a lance; and apply ointment to the end of the cautery with oil or with beeswax or with mucilage of fenugreek or similar substance; And insert it into the anus with ease, and have the minister take the bag and extract it with two fingers and press it firmly until all that is in the intestine is evacuated through the ligature; and then remove the ligature and lift the patient's legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	If the medicine does not produce any effect, hold it for as long as possible; and if you lie on it for a whole night, it is more effective in healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cauterize the opening in cases of intestinal issues and the swelling is heavy, hold the cautery inside until the healing takes place.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if the hemorrhoids or apertures are long and persistent, hold the cautery close to them gently, using those same cauterization techniques that have proven effective on infants.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the cure of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And you said in the division of the cure of wounds that this was suitable for the free man, and thus I say that the cure of those wounds should be done by hand and with medicine according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So I say that wounds are diversified according to how they are caused, and according to the location on which they fall.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which wounds occur are such as from an arrow wound, or incision of space, or percussion with a lance, or with a fist, or with a spear, or similar to those of other kinds of wounds.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	The translation is: "But the plagues that are in the parts of the body are like a plague which falls on the head, or the elbow, or the feet, or the belly, or the groin, and seem to be similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	The translation is: "And I recommend the cure for some plagues, so that you can abandon this reasoning and rule over others plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	The translation is: "And I will begin with the simple pains of the head, for the memory of the composed conclusions will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	The translation is: "And I say that when it happens to the head a simple pain and not a fracture, then consider this: if it's due to a stone or similar, and only one chain has broken alone and it's a great plague and fears about that malignant illness of apostaema, caut, you should therefore get out and apply fleubotoma to the cephalic area immediately, and don't delay; and extract according to the sanctum on the amount of the vertu of him if not any other prohibition prevents fleubotomia, more so if the sanctum is extracted from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	The humoral theory of the opposite side of the injured part is being considered, and care should be taken to avoid the patient's belly and bowels, as well as large food and drink.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if the injury is small, then nothing should be prohibited as its cause, and therefore the food should be reduced and not brought near to meat or drink.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	Pause on the wound, if it happens that an apostema occurs, apply caution, cut or press into rose oil, olive oil, or a substance where it is stained.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is secure that an apostema has occurred, then pause on the wound, if it is new and the air has not changed, then apply small powder which I will recommend.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	But if the air has already changed that one, then pause on a scab until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is great or is due to a space and similarity, and the lips are not properly adjusted for plugging, then adjust those with suture according to what I will recommend of their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the disease has not been discovered by the bone and sinew, and is not a retention of it but a small suspender, then inscribe that and place care in the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in its place rather than code, and command the patient to eat foods in which is grossness: caps and forms like them, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	If you find rotting flesh in the bone that does not stick to it, then insert all of this into the wound and cast it away, and place care.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these afflictions there is an artery or vein from which blood flows and cannot be cut with medicines, then inquire about the artery, and if you find that uncut, then inscribe it with a spatula or ligature; and if it requires so that what has been said does not give confidence, then cauterize within until the wound is severed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	If these afflictions are simple and small, then the cause of them is light; therefore make powder on those powders, which when consolidated, change the air that affects those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The translation is:
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	Appraise the surface of the affected area with powder and liquid, and do not remove it while it is in this condition, lest it be considered an ulcer, which cannot be healed through the medicine until it is cleansed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	There is none of this alone to cut, unless there is venom in it, and you will not send it to the dragon.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And it is also done this type of operation for great wounds when it is necessary to stop them and straighten them out, and only for those recent wounds that have not been altered by the air.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	If the air has altered them, and more so when it is in summer, then you will not understand the position of this powder, rather cure those with that which have been said, by placing yourself over those wet swellings, or over those flour dusts with water and honey until they are applied to.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens that the wound is a fracture in the bone, and it is small, then you will extract this by hand.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	The treatment for head fractures in this text refers to poisoning.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds on the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs on the neck, it is not in the same treatment as head wounds, which are simpler.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or an artery, then if it's a nerve, it should be avoided in treatment, for it causes violent inflammation, like thorns and itching, and is similar to venom, which damages surrounding tissues and counters that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not apply ointment over the wound on any account, for the substance of nerves is poison and their continuation leads to the brain, which is the worst of all the body members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz. Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	When a great wound is present, then administer stitches or close the lips of the patient, and place them in care until they are healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound has great depth or occurs with a lower part of the pus being expelled, then perforate that in the location where it is most convenient.

Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if already the vertebrae of the neck or all are incised, and the veins of the neck have been saved, then thus adjust the ligaments of the chain with stitches over the canal of the neck and do not touch that; cut it equally and reduce it to its natural figure, and set it straight again with a decent structure, and let it be exposed for a few days; and cure it with ointment in which there is stinging and inflammation until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has already reached into the bone, then perforate it, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all that you can from them; and thus that which is not suitable to be sewn up, let it heal within itself until the wound dries out, and is separated, and the discomfort of it is alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	If the wound is recent, then sprinkle powder over that powder which has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if there is a wound with an opening or fistula, then cure that with this same water which you will remember in its capital.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of throat wounds or swellings that form between the shoulder blades, and are formed with a space, a thorn, an arrowhead, or a swelling.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it's a blow from an arrow or a thorn and repeated several times in its depth, then consider that the wound is more prone to ventosis (air or gas) than if the patient has leprosy; then you know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	If in him there is no depth to the wound and the plague is recent with his strength, then place powder in it for the first hour, and do not press upon it so that it does not retain the strength in its depth and returns to the heart; but instead place a compressive substance around it, twice daily.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	If the compress is not available, then place cloth over the wound to absorb what comes from the humidity; and have the patient sleep on the wound so that the liquid comes out tightly.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the disease is not happening for three days or more, and there's no stomach spasm, heart tremor, or chest stricture, and other good dispositions of him, you know that the disease is saved; then cure it with calomel and another cure within until he is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if his healing is excluded, and it has been open for all time, then you know that already a fistula has been made; therefore cure him at your capital.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	If the disease is due to a cut in space or bone, and it's simple on the surface of the foot or toes, then cure that with the same thing as before, preceded by suture, if large, or powder, if small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if already a fracture has occurred in the bone, and those pieces are already separated, then you will twist the wound to extract those pieces, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separate, then you will lance them into where the wound is expected to open, as their removal alleviates the pain.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	The text means: And of the other accidents in the other members, the youthful remedy for cure is what we have already said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	About the stomach ailments.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disorder that occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or intermittent.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great some times the intestine or nerve of the intestine is involved, so that it is necessary to make an incision into them and suture their being more violent and subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult by another means, and it's uncertain if the reduction of them will be more difficult, unless you cut into their place soon, for when they are closed up and swollen, making their intestine difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is intermittent, for in that one it's not difficult to reduce the intestine, as it is in the two other species mentioned.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And it is wise that the belly suture can be done in four ways, but two of them are common and convenient for other body ailments.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other stitches belong to the other wounds, but however they are more specific in the wound of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend to you whatever exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So I say that when the wound is small and there is no cause for the intestine to protrude from it, and it's difficult to reduce it, then this can happen in two ways: either due to the narrowness of the disruption as we have said, or because of the swelling of the intestine due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is the case, then cover yourself by scaling it in such a way that you submerge a sponge soaked in water only, or what you can get in water with vinegar, camphor, and spices, into the intestine so that the inflammation is resolved.

De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	The translation of the given line is:

De extraccio de sagetas.	Of arrow extraction.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to the species, and according to the locations of the body in which they occur, because it is their diversity that distinguishes them, among those that have large points and small ones, concave and solid; among those with three angles, and those that have tongues; and among those that have stakes.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua. And there was no accident in the place that the arrow had achieved; and I continued with the implanture on it for many days, and there was no new accident; and the wound was consolidated in the meantime, and the patient recovered from the extremity of him through space for many days until a day felt the arrow within his nose, and returned to me.

De fleubotomia de las venas.	On the ligation of veins.

E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the excess is great, apply, for example, olive oil of marigold, or olive balm oil, or turpentine oil, or anise oil, and to its likeness.

Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that needs to be done to regulate the swelling of the swollen veins before venesection.

E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the tracheas of infants and those who are weak are different from those of young people and strong bodies.

E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda. Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine; and it is healing of fractures and accidents in bones.

Capitol primier.	First principal matter or doctrine.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of fractures of bones, considering those for which certain prerequisites are necessary, before we begin to remember the fractured members and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us speak in the prologue of this chapter about the sums of the discourse; and the capitals with which we intend to understand them, at the beginning are certainly the works and the location where the truth lies for those; so it is you and they who will be able to know or learn these noble arts other than your own.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore say that when such accidents happen to any fracture or dislocation or twisting or breaking, you should cover yourself with the same precautions as before, whether it be the flebotomy or the application of heat, or whatever else, if there is no other cause, thus as weakness of virtue, or that which occurs in childhood, or because of wear and tear, or due to great heat, or great cold.

And therefore let it be prepared in a seven-year-old stew of greens and fowl meat and crab-like substance; and prohibit thick meats and fill with food if possible, so that the veins are filled with all food, until you are certain of applying cauterization to the wound, and if not afraid of bleeding from the member.

And thus, when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the malady should be fed with nutritious foods of meat and great and heavy matter in which there is viscosity, just like wholesome food made from bread soaked in water, rice, capons, eggs, fish, and beef, and fresh pork, large and similar to those, and this regimen is done to facilitate coagulation of the fracture more lightly and with less pain.

It is wise to know that bones break when they are in the hands of a man who is old and in his prime, but also those of the decrepit, for it is impossible that they should continue and become consolidated according to their nature by the dryness of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continue according to their nature all the time by the dryness of those members, and it is like these that are continuing and consolidated in the end of life, just as the bones of small children.

But nature also adjusts and connects the broken bone from every part, without any similar cause that would cause swelling, where it becomes stuck and tight among the broken parts, until the end of strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning, when no obstacle prevents its work.

Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a great diversity of fracture according to the diversity of the limb.

Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Secret sign of a bone fracture.

Be careful, according to your skill, so that it does not happen to the patient through your operation or injury. Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of a fractured arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus. De sermo en dislocacio.	On the displacement of a joint.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Displacement is a sudden occurrence at any of the joints of the body, for which it is prohibited to move, and the figure of the limb is reduced, bringing on the patient great pain and serious injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore when a dislocation occurs, one must immediately attempt to reduce it, and not delay in doing so, because if it is delayed, the joint becomes inflamed and very painful with that, making it difficult to perform the reduction of a dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And so it is not to be expected that you should be proud or upright in the hour of separation, for many times we have seen spasm and pain arrive unexpectedly.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, it is to be hoped that you will retreat into the depths of the ulcer, and let the separation take place while you pause; and let the member be loosened in water cold and oil, and return it to ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the entire member is cured with what returns in its place, and memory comes back to that spot.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I already have ordered the capitals of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the top of the body, the superior part comes above until the left side.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Caput XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the cure of dislocation of the jaw, left.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	When both jaws are dislocated if not torn; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two manners: either they are remade from their joints with little movement, or they are completely dislocated and completed, until they are softened at the beginning of the joint while saliva flows from the ulcer and it cannot hold that nor can close its mouth, and its tongue is wrapped in its word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is total and complete, then it should be covered with a light reduction, and not delayed for too long.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And that's the minister should have the patient, and then let the doctor put one finger of his one hand into the space between the dislocated jawbone and teeth, from below up to the dislocation of the jawbone inside the mouth, if it's on one side; or insert both fingers evenly, if it's on two sides, and take care of other parts of his hands that are outside which will grab; and he commands the patient to stop his jaws and release them so they don't come out from any part; and the doctor grabs the jawbone and puts it back inside until he returns to his place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if it's hard to reduce the dislocation, and especially if both jaws are severely dislocated, then he should administer a mixture of water and cold oil inside while he does the light reduction of both at once and doesn't delay the reduction of both completely, as they have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when you return and are lowered in, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not softened, then place yourself on those powdery drapams with cerot, and let it be made from wax and oiled rose; and tie it with ease and thin ropes.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on their back, and the head is placed between two aurelles, so that they will not complain at the first attempt or to the left; and do not force them to chew any food; until when their body is freed from the lion's strength, in order that when the pains are alleviated and the mandibles are numb, then let them speak as much as they can.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And thus provide with ease, and do not labor over the attention to the mouth, concerning eating and drinking and urination, until when the mandible is numb and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	But if it is hard to reduce two dislocated mandibles when they are displaced in one hour and not returned to their proper place, then numerous previous accidents have occurred, such as fevers and frequent vomiting, and the stomach is swollen with great pain, and there comes a pure but violent colic.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	When you have done that, you will know it is a loss; and often what has been lost can be seen after four days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter xxv.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the displacement of the wrist joint and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The wrist joint is not displaced from the body's bone due to its continuity on the foot; and sometimes it is displaced outward at the beginning, and this is declared in writing.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the malady is laid on his back and his arms are extended.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And place a constraint on the location with your palm, using a firm bandage so that it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And place pressure on that plaster and powder, and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that person who has seized the vein and continues it, is not displaced on any day; rather, if it is reduced and enclosed as they have said, and according to what you have provided.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Place your hand on that plaster, powder it, and tighten the dressings, and command the sick person to remain quiet and rest until they are healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	This is the method of curing that reduces the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Section xxvi.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of muscle dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated but rather in three ways: one of which is dislocated from the start of the tendon to the point where it starts.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated from the start of one side of the muscle, and this is done so that it is not dislocated from the other side by the shoulder joint; nor is it dislocated towards the front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And it is more severely dislocated and protrudes outward from the areas beyond the start of the tendon; and more so in those where the flesh is scanty, it is less dislocated; but in those with more fatty tissue, it projects outward with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	When a strong blow occurs on an acute home, percussion or crushing, and the muscle is swollen with an abscess, it becomes caught by this that already is dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore you should push this into while standing on solid ground, and then process the healing of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that dislocation occurs when the joints are left undisturbed; so that you may distinguish between the muscle displaced and the healthy muscle, for you will feel between them various differences manifest, and you will feel in the head of the muscle a concavity where the swelling meets the pressure from the surface in such a way as to produce a lump, and at the patient's feet cannot reduce the hand to its original position, nor be able to move it completely.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is a dislocation, then you will feel the foot or leg swollen, and you will therefore carefully examine the manifestation of the touch, and do not conceal it.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation, a gentle reduction is made when the joint is fresh and the patient is in childhood.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises his hand to the joints in question; and then places his sleeves aside from the swelling, and elevates the joint with great force to its proper place, and the minister raises his hand, and extends it in such a way that it returns gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	Joint pain caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body and lead to dislocation, which occurs several days after the initial injury, is treated by bathing in cool water and administering an ointment made from rue, fenugreek, and meletilla, similar to the treatment for a high fever.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	The ulcer should be raised on the patient's back and placed in a harness that prevents movement between lift and strictura, and the doctor places his foot on the spine, elevates the head of the muscle with a vice, ties the leg of the patient so that it does not move excessively, and another servant holds the patient's head so that it does not move excessively, for fear that it will return to its original place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	If you wish, reduce the ulcer in this manner: for it is that you present a man who is longer than the ulcer, and located on the opposite side, and insert his muscle into the space of the ulcer and elevate the tissue around the ulcer until the ulcer is suspended in air, and another servant pulls back the leg of the patient away from its abdomen.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the malady is mild, then cover it with another cause to suspend it, so that it does not worsen, for soon the displacement will return.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in this manner: so that it is laid on the ground a long stick with a rounded head, like a ball of mortar, not thick or thin, and you place over its head drapes linen, and the malady is standing according to the length of the stick, and extend the hand of him towards other parts; and extend the body of him of the other part with firmness, so that the joint returns to its place at great speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce him for all the causes that we have mentioned, then you use this cure: so that you take a stick of the length equal to the span of two arms, and its width be four fingers, and its thickness removed from the shoulder according to this shape:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And you place over the rounded head linen straps to prevent the stick from drawing out the malady.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	The translation is: And place them on the tip of the patient's body, and extend your hand or arm over the wound into the parts you have exposed, and tie the flesh around the assistant and arm and the extremity of your hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	The translation is: Place your arm over a scale of stairs according to the size, and stretch out your hand into the parts you have exposed, and let the other thing hang from the other side, as it is in the joint.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	The translation is: And when the instrument has completed it according to any manner possible, and afterwards cover with a woolen gauze of size; and then pause in plaster prepared from powder of mill am enses [meaning ground mallow] and album of hou [possibly allum or alum, a type of salt] on all the muscle, as if it is turned down, and place stitches on the wound again with strictura [a surgical suture]; and the ligament be rolled over the plaster, and his hand attached to the neck of him, and let be so that his hand is not bound for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	The translation is: And cover the food of the sick person little, until the member is comfortable, as it is lighter to healing of him.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	The text means: And therefore place meat near it (or on) in order to be eaten after seven or eight days; and so if it is not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	The text means: But if the joint is dislocated because of frequent humidity or due to another cause, then cover it with cautery on three tracts, as said in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	The text means: And if all that is done and after seven days the ligament is loosened and the joint is not closed, then reduce the plaster and binding on it some times, but it will not be firm and the arm cannot be lifted to the affected parts, for sure the nerves of him, which are at the top of the muscle, either cut or extended or softened, know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	The text means: From the dislocation of that area, it is necessary to treat the foot and breast or the parts behind, reduction is done with impulse and extension with hands until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	The text means: And the other binding should be administered in that area, and care should be taken to heal it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	If the treatment fails and gravity sets in on the member, and tardiness in movement of it, then the illness uses of baths moistures visible between that gravity is alleviated and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter xxvii.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the cure of dislocation of the wrist.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know well that the joint of the wrist is dislocated by difficulty and similar returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, and most of all at the front part rather than the back part; and the dislocation does not hide itself when you press on it with your fingers or touch according to some figure being dislocated, and when you adjust the wrist, it becomes clear what it is, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch the affected muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And know that when cuts are made, and the dislocation is reduced as soon as possible at the front because it will bring a swollen cauterization, because if you see the cauterized area, it's difficult to reduce it, and little relief is obtained for all; and most of all when it is in the back parts, because it's worse than all other types of dislocation, and more pain, and frequently death follows that kind.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	The translation is: And the restoration of him, when it is possible to reduce it, is that his hand be stretched out with both hands, and his arm be stretched out, and the physician's hands are on the joint and let him, and he pushes the joint with the pressure of his palms into its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	The translation is: But if the dislocation is in the anterior parts, then he returns to that position, where he folds his hand with his own hand, and strikes the joint with the pressure of his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	The translation is: And if the dislocation does not obey to the reduction, then he administers violent extension and force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	The translation is: And it is that two ministers will stretch the arm, and hold the extension with two other ministers so that it does not rebound from the force of the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	The translation is: And he will turn the arm so that it covers all its parts, as if it were wrapped with a long, folded cloth on his hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	The translation is: And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, he applies that area with no oil so that these causes may help in lubrication of the joint and facilitate it, and he pushes the joint with a violent push until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Let the reduction of the limb be placed on that area where the stiffness and excoriation are most abundant, and it is extended in the direction of the descending structure, and the arm is suspended from the neck, and let it be left for a few days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And now loosen it; and therefore if the joint is formed in its own place, then you will loosen the ligament of it and relax that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	If you see the joint is not strengthened, then you will apply plaster and ligament, and relax that for several days until it is stabilized; and now loosen that.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to him that the gravity of the reduction of the joint occurs and the disposition is in movement, then you administer moisture in bath and subtle friction, compression, until it is alleviated; or place pressure over the joint attached, because it is a great cause of motion; and now tie it, and relax that on bone both day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And now fasten that, and put it in bath; and when clean, then you will rub the joint with early friction, and tie over that, because it is a rough motion, one time, and the second, and the third.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	I have a condition of the bowels.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	If you wish, pause over that cow's hide which is wet and flayed at the border, and apply it there with strength on several occasions, for that is moist and reduce its disposition.
