De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	The cure for a broken collarbone, which is between the arm and the shoulder.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	When the shoulder joint is dislocated, sometimes it's lightly reduced, but in other cases, the opposite is true: the reduction of a dislocation in other joints takes longer to achieve, and however rapid it may be done in the hour the joint is dislocated, it must be done before the pus forms or an abscess occurs on it.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of a dislocation is that you place the shoulder joint of the sick person on a table, and the minister extends the arm of that person, and the doctor places his hand or palm over the proximity of the joint, and pushes it in until it returns to its original place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and when pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	If you return to it soon, good is; otherwise, hold fast that joint and apply the poultice to the swelling and ease it; and do not go back there, because if so, it will not relieve or you can't reduce it more than what has passed through it in the last few days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however the joint is subject to its own tortuosity; and do not notice any disease in the patient, but that the flesh is softened and you cannot tighten any cause; therefore you must know that the nerves are cut or torn, and not that it is tight with cauterization, so apply pressure to it and make it heavier, as this will confer no cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the patient has returned, hold over the poultice with which you have previously marked it, and let it rest for four days; and after that, loosen it and let it rest, and make his hand active.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of him is maintained and no accidents occur to him with any gravity, then hold that joint in warm water and apply friction a few times, until he is alleviated.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	The treatment of dislocation of the finger.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some times it is found that the finger is completely out of place.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger is displaced to the two sides of the palm or towards the belly of it, then stretch the finger and drive the displacement back with your thumbs, until you return.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And provide support to the head of the finger and suspend that which is in the part where it is displaced, and let it rest for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And suspend that one and extend the finger into it, so that on the third day it may be set in its place.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it cannot be set, use that second method, and do not cease to release that one in the day, and exercise it with movement, and release it at night; and do this for many days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same to it, if it is displaced towards the belly of the hand, and release that one into its former place and perform this operation on it first, until it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	It seems to be causing discomfort in other parts of the body.

De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of joint dislocation of the spine.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute. De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the cure of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Be aware that the joint of the ankle and the muscle do not suffer only from dislocation, but rather a separate injury to those same joints, with swelling and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four manners: it can be displaced towards the toes, away from them, or towards the front, or towards the back.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And more so is it displaced in the lower parts of the body, and little in the upper or inner parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The cause of the dislocation in the lower parts of the body is that when you adjust the bed of the patient with a healthy person, it becomes longer and the pain is more pronounced than before, the patient cannot bend their knee because of the healthy one, and this is the place where the swollen tongue is stuck, so the head of the hernia has already become trapped here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The cause of that person who suffers from the dislocation is in the outer parts, because their accidents are contrary to this one.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The cause of that person who suffers from dislocation in the inner parts is that the bladder expands according to its fullness, but more so because they cannot bear the pain that is in the bowels, and if it pushes further and cannot be relieved over there; and the urine of them is retained and the swelling of them is swollen, and therefore the walking of them should be done on the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The cause of that person who suffers from dislocation in the inner parts is that they do not expand the bowels, nor can they bend the back because it softens the intestine, and their bladder is shorter than another one, and the swelling is softened, and the head of the hernia is stuck at that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	When the reduction of this dislocation is considered, as is often the case, if the dislocation is old and antiquated, then since it has already passed that you administer a reduction, and follow its disposition, not all; therefore do not cover it up.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	Therefore, in that case, if the dislocation is recent and one of the four kinds of dislocations, then you count on it to return to its normal state by turning the joint and stretching those parts towards the digits and the foreparts; and also to that hand which has returned and do not seek any other cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if it does not return in this manner, then it is likely that you prepare a strong poultice and stretch the fold of his part, or place your hands on him, or bind him with a ligament which is tied over the fold of the said wound; and another servant extends the hand of that person as to meet those hands, which put their hands in the folds of him; and you also apply a strong poultice on the root of the wound, and hold another servant tight to the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	The part of the body that has become inflamed or swollen is where the inflammation begins or ends.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	If the inflammation extends to all those places on one side, where the illness is elevated above the ground and remains attached.

Therefore if the dislocation returns to that which we have said, it is good; and if not, then it requires all sorts of procedures to talk about one's own cure.

E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and apply that one, and extend it as in your first structure, and lightly touch it on three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And place that person on the way to recovery for as many days as possible before they are mobile again.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter thirty-two.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of a broken limb.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The limb is dislocated in three manners: it can be dislocated outwardly, inwardly, or leftwardly (toward the back), and not downward.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of a broken limb is that commands the sick person to apply their cushion over the wound; then it seems like the bone is broken.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration for all of these manners is that you make a cut on the sick person's flesh, in such a way that it extends their own cushion; then take your two hands to his face, and place your foot between his feet; and then place your hand adhering to his broken bone, with your palms, and bind those between your fingers over the broken limb with strength, and another servant extends their foot until the bone returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The translated line is: And so when you have made a return, it should be that their cushion adheres to the space with non-weight bearing.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And so you should place that one and have the cushion adhere to the space, and you should tie those ones with a bandage for three days or four, and then untie them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the bed of ambulance for more than three days, until the person is recovered and relieved.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	However, if the reduction of your hand is postponed, then give more extensive stretching to the ligaments of which in the treatment of the preceding fractured arm.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes gets mended by small mobilization, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the degree, and the dislocation of it is done in the medial partitions or in the anterior partitions.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And so, the sign of the ankle's dislocation is that it swells before reaching the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	May the cure of removal be through gentle return, and that it may become easy to apply with great care before returning.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	May the cure of him when he is dislocated in a correct manner be easy to do, and that you make clean the wound deeply, and hold one strong and brave minister behind the two joints of him in the middle place of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And take your right hand to the upper part of the foot, and your left hand to the lower part of the foot in the place of the cavity.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And lift the foot with your right hand, and hold it with your left hand for two times, then extend the left hand; and push the foot down with the heel of the foot towards the cushion so that the foot may work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice, as agreed upon.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And push the foot down into the cushion for the third time, and you are at the cavity.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then if you return in one turn or two according to this manner, and if you press the foot together, it is good; but if not, longs as you repeat the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If it is forbidden to reduce the swelling with what you have at hand, then place the ulcer on its back over the ground, and put a padded cloth on top of the ground, and that which will enclose between the patient's thighs, and you already have wrapped the patient in a sheet so that they do not lose their ulcer.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And place the minister's thighs on top of them, and another minister extend the leg over its hands or a towel that lies on the neck of the leg; and another minister extend itself against the extension of its belly, so that the cloth is extended between the patient's thighs, retaining what is inside, in order that its swelling does not be directed to those parts from which it deviates.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And place the doctor on one side, and another minister hold the healthy cavity to those parts that are left, because the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and you declare the state of the reduction, then put on plaster and extend that which lies firmly under it, and tie the leg with a bandage to the cushion.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	I fear or take precautions of the nerves that are behind the heel, lest the ligature over them be violent and cause a great torment.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And stretch it for two days or three, and if the ligature is softened, extend that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And lift it on the fourth day or on the eighth, and prohibit the patient from lying for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	However, if it is necessary to enter that space again, there is no secure safety that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted, and therefore do not apply to it.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	If it happens to the apothema (wound), then fear that you will administer in the excision of it, as explained before in another location of cure and embrocation, until it is closed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	The End.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the Treatment of Dislocation of the Joints of the Feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	So that the one who is dislocated be reduced with little extension of effort; and this which is not difficult, it is lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the middle of the heel bone, then always cover that the patient's foot with a woolen cloth or over a table, and so it should be as if they had gone.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And place you on your side, and put that your foot over it which lies near the joints, and place a calkan on your foot so that it remains inside until you return, and look for that it is already covered up and does not appear in the high part.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place their belly of the foot on a table that holds the whole foot, which has two caps, and tighten that one by binding structure decently and firmly for three days; and after removing it, let him rest with walking for some days, until he is strengthened and ensured of his cure.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocations that are caused by injury or fracture, or of any other cause.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occur and you perforse yourself in the wound of that and in the restoring of him, many frequently succeed with death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	Joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	Forcedly, you must now immediately do from him of the reduction in the beginning of the cause, just as I have previously mentioned to perform an apsectomy caut.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according to what you want, you will immediately administer a regimen that cuts an apsectomy caut and treats the plague as it suits, for this is the remedy of dry coughs.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if a dislocation occurs with a fracture and the separated bones cause injury, then you will perform the statement of their order, and do in this way what has been said in simple illnesses of this sort, which precedes in those areas.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And be careful and avoid along the way according to your judgment which precedes my preaching; for this is better for you than it is good for me, and more stable in my glory, and more blessings to you true in your time those are which you will see.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus I finish the words of Albucasis perfectly as if God had blessed them.
Amen.	End of text.
